channel.title: Directed to people who can code/program
channel.description:
Ok, i gave this ago myself, and i got errors, so i'm gonna post here for help..
Can someone help me make a command, that will send a command to all the mods/admins online. And if no mods or admins are online, it sends the message to a .txt file..?
So someone types ::report (Player) (Reason).. And it sends a yell to all mods and admins saying.. like..
[Player Reporting ABUSER]: [Reason - ............]
And if no mods or admins are on, it sends that message to a .txt file.. Like..
[Player Reporting ABUSER]: [Reason - ............]
..
Would [s]rlly[/s] [b]REALLY[/b] apreciate help on this. Ty..

modYell method?
[/quote]Don’t worry about that. Just use what I gave you. And did it work?[/quote]

no it didn’t :S

@TeleNubby wrote:

::abuse message player?[/quote]
::abuse message(msg can include player’s name)

micky-g:

ouy akte het kicm uot fo em os tfus onob kk se if your that smart

“You take the mick out of me so stfu noob kk see if your that smart”
I take the mick out of you? And I really do hope you spelled it like that on purpose.

theres the code from dodian source.
Yes, but you're missing the modYell(String msg) method and that doesn't write to a file. ;)

if (command.startsWith("staff") && (command.length() > 4)) { String text = command.substring(4); modYell("[staff] " + playerName + ": " + Character.toUpperCase(text.charAt(0)) + text.substring(1)); }

theres the code from dodian source.

@TeleNubby wrote:

Put the sendMessage method in your Player.java. Then for the second error… change that line to

ra.write(new String("[REPORTED ABUSE FROM"+playerName+"] Message: "+msg).getBytes());

I fixed it on my last post now too.

EDIT: Fixed again. Use this one now.

item.title: Directed to people who can code/program
item.dc:creator: @TeleNubby TeleNubby
item.description:
@TeleNubby wrote:

I’ll do this off of the top of my head.

Command:

else if(command.startsWith("abuse")) {
     int staffAmount = 0; String msg = command.substring(6);
     for(int c = 0; c < server.playerHandler.maxPlayers; c++) {
          if(server.playerHandler.players[c].playerRights >= 1) {
               staffAmount++;
               if(staffAmount > 0) {
               server.playerHandler.players[c].sendMessage("[ABUSE] Report from "+playerName+": "+msg);
               }
          }
     }
     if(staffAmount == 0) {
          try {
               FileOutputStream ra = new FileOutputStream("abuselogs.txt", true);
               ra.write(new String("[REPORTED ABUSE FROM"+playerName+"] Message: "+msg).getBytes());
               ra.close();
          } catch(IOException IOE) { }
     }
}

Pretty basic and I just made it. It works like this:
::abuse message/name

It will send it to every player with rights of atleast 1. If there are no players like that it will write to a file named abuselogs.txt.

Tell me if it works.

Read full topic

item.title: Directed to people who can code/program
item.dc:creator: @X-J-K-X X-J-K-X
item.description:
@X-J-K-X wrote:

[quote=“micky-g, post:8, topic:159452”]i might have the file like that i do yes i will get it for you [br][br][size=1]Posted on: November 21, 2007, 12:01:30 PM[/size][hr]bw = new BufferedWriter(new FileWriter(“logs/chatlogs.txt”, true));
bw.write("[—"+report+" reported by “+playerName+”—]");
bw.newLine();
if(mute == 1) {
bw.write("[—"+report+" was muted by “+playerName+”—]");
bw.newLine();
}
bw.flush();
} catch (IOException ioe) {
ioe.printStackTrace();
} finally {
if (bw != null) try {
bw.close();
} catch (IOException ioe2) {
sendMessage(“Error reporting user.”);
}
}

  try {
     bw = new BufferedWriter(new FileWriter("./logs//chatlogs.txt", true));
 bw.write("[---"+report+" reported by "+playerName+"---]");
 bw.newLine();
     if(mute == 1) {
 bw.write("[---"+report+" was muted by "+playerName+"---]");
 bw.newLine();
     }
 bw.flush();
  } catch (IOException ioe) {
 ioe.printStackTrace();
  } finally {
 if (bw != null) try {
    bw.close();
 } catch (IOException ioe2) {
    sendMessage("Error reporting user.");

that should be it[/quote]

Read please, i can do that myself… I need the COMMAND/METHOD… Which will send a message to ALL MODS/ADMINS online…

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @micky-g micky-g
item.description:
@micky-g wrote:

i might have the file like that i do yes i will get it for you [br][br][size=1]Posted on: November 21, 2007, 12:01:30 PM[/size][hr]bw = new BufferedWriter(new FileWriter(“logs/chatlogs.txt”, true));
bw.write("[—"+report+" reported by “+playerName+”—]");
bw.newLine();
if(mute == 1) {
bw.write("[—"+report+" was muted by “+playerName+”—]");
bw.newLine();
}
bw.flush();
} catch (IOException ioe) {
ioe.printStackTrace();
} finally {
if (bw != null) try {
bw.close();
} catch (IOException ioe2) {
sendMessage(“Error reporting user.”);
}
}

  try {
     bw = new BufferedWriter(new FileWriter("./logs//chatlogs.txt", true));
 bw.write("[---"+report+" reported by "+playerName+"---]");
 bw.newLine();
     if(mute == 1) {
 bw.write("[---"+report+" was muted by "+playerName+"---]");
 bw.newLine();
     }
 bw.flush();
  } catch (IOException ioe) {
 ioe.printStackTrace();
  } finally {
 if (bw != null) try {
    bw.close();
 } catch (IOException ioe2) {
    sendMessage("Error reporting user.");

that should be it
